words.definition: in a calm and even manner; not varying.
words.example: She spoke equably, maintaining a calm tone throughout the meeting.

words.definition: a group of advisers, assistants, or others accompanying an important person.
words.example: The queen arrived with her retinue of advisors and guards.

words.definition: carried out with a minimum of effort or reflection.
words.example: He gave a perfunctory nod before leaving the room.

words.definition: representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class.
words.example: She was the quintessential example of grace and elegance.

words.definition: having an obstinately uncooperative attitude towards authority or discipline.
words.example: The recalcitrant child refused to obey his parents' instructions.

words.definition: having or showing keen mental discernment and good judgment; wise or shrewd.
words.example: Her sagacious advice helped him navigate through the difficult situation.

words.definition: tending to keep a firm hold of something; clinging or adhering closely.
words.example: Despite the challenges, she remained tenacious in her pursuit of justice.
Smartphones have become ubiquitous in today's society.

words.definition: having a very eager approach to an activity; consuming large quantities of food.
words.example: She was a voracious reader, devouring books one after another.
The old man's face was wizened and covered in deep lines.

words.definition: having or showing a dislike of or prejudice against people from other countries.
words.example: The xenophobic policies of the government were widely criticized.

words.definition: have an intense feeling of longing for something, typically something that one has lost or been separated from.
words.example: He yearned for the days when he could travel freely.
She was a zealous supporter of environmental causes.

words.example: She spoke equably, maintaining a calm tone throughout the meeting.
